title: From a flashy entry to partially shutting shop over alleged tax evasion: inside Shein’s roadblock
text:
Shein emerged out of nowhere in 2017 as an affordable seller of women’s clothing. But a Mumbai customs investigation alleged that Shein was violating local laws. It looked like the party was over for the Chinese company, which does not have any local presence. But surprise, Shein is still operational.

Models on a ramp at a Shein fashion show in Mumbai; courtesy of Shein via Facebook

Bombay High Court filings, a decision is pending in the case between Sino India Etail and the Mumbai customs, while the latter is holding on to the seized goods. The outcome of this case will decide the Chinese retailer’s future in the country. But it’s not like one airport is stopping its operations anyway. ( Graphic by Abdul Shafiq) There are some things money can’t buy. For everything else, there’s, for sure, a cheaper alternative available in India. It’s a value-driven country, where even millennials relate to memes of getting free dhania (coriander leaves) along with vegetables. So, what happens when a China-based company enters the country’s online-fashion space, offering clothes at nearly half the price (sometimes evenBombay High Court filings, a decision is pending in the case between Sino India Etail and the Mumbai customs, while the latter is holding on to the seized goods. The outcome of this case will decide the Chinese retailer’s future in the country. But it’s not like one airport is stopping its operations anyway. ( Graphic by Abdul Shafiq)
